intro: Melilotoides tibetica, commonly known as Tibetan melilot, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Its leaves are trifoliate, and it produces yellow or white blooms that attract pollinators. Due to its unique ecological niche, it plays a role in stabilizing soil in high-altitude regions.
